00022  * @file   apt-dmet-translation.cpp
00023  * @author Mybrid Spalding
00024  * @date   Wed Jun  4 08:29:07 PDT 2008
00025  * @brief  Commandline controller wrapper around TranslateEngine.run().
00026  */
00027 
00028 //
00029 #include "translation/TranslationEngine.h"
00030 //
00031 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00032 #include "util/Err.h"
00033 #include "util/Fs.h"
00034 #include "util/LogStream.h"
00035 #include "util/Util.h"
00036 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00037 
00038 using namespace std;
00039 
00040 
00041 /*****************************************************************************/
00042 /**
00043  * translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack
00044  * Synopsis:
00045  *
00046  *  There is a catch 22 where the command line message handlers need to
00047  * have the PGOptions information in order to set up the message handling
00048  * log file name, etc. Resolve this by passing in a call back to the
00049  * TranslateEngine constructor which initializes the PGOptions.
00050  *
00051  * @param atdOopts - filled in with all the PGOptions data.
00052  *
00053  * @return - nada, initializes message handling.
00054  */
00055 /*****************************************************************************/
00056 void translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack(ADTOptions & adtOpts)
00057 {
00058 
00059   Err::setThrowStatus(true);
00060 
00061   std::string verboseLogName;
00062 
00063   if (adtOpts.m_logFile != "") {
00064     verboseLogName = adtOpts.m_logFile;
00065   }
00066   else {
00067     verboseLogName = Fs::join(adtOpts.m_outputDir,"apt-dmet-translation.log");
00068   }
00069 
00070   std::ofstream *verboseOFStream = new std::ofstream;
00071 
00072   if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(adtOpts.m_outputDir)) {
00073     if (Fs::mkdirPath(adtOpts.m_outputDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00074       APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + adtOpts.m_outputDir);
00075     }
00076   }
00077   Fs::mustOpenToWrite(*(verboseOFStream), verboseLogName.c_str());
00078 
00079   ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM logVerbosity = ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION;
00080   if (adtOpts.m_verbosity > ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION) {
00081     logVerbosity = (ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM) adtOpts.m_verbosity;
00082   }
00083 
00084   LogStream *verboseLogStream = new LogStream(logVerbosity,  verboseOFStream, false);
00085 
00086   Verbose::pushMsgHandler(verboseLogStream);
00087   Verbose::pushProgressHandler(verboseLogStream);
00088   Verbose::pushWarnHandler(verboseLogStream);
00089   Verbose::setLevel(adtOpts.m_verbosity);
00090 
00091   return;
00092 }
00093 // end translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack
00094 /*****************************************************************************/
00095 /*****************************************************************************/
00096 /**
00097  * apt-dmet-translation main
00098  *
00099  * @param argc -
00100  * @param argv -
00101  * @return - exit 0 when ok.
00102  */
00103 /*****************************************************************************/
00104 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00105 {
00106   try {
00107     /// @todo This isnt how an engine should be invoked or have options set.
00108     ///       Attemping to process the "--help" option causes BaseEngine to print:
00109     ///          "running TranslationEngine" before it prints the help message.
00110     TranslationEngine(argv, C_CMDLINE, &translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack).run();
00111     exit(0);
00112   } 
00113   catch(...) {
00114       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00115       return 1;
00116   }
00117   return 1;
00118 }
00119 // end main
